messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] move or stay?
messages.msgSnippet: ... I agree and with me it s not just my family but our homeschool support group. We have great laws here in MO but if they changed we would move to KS and
messages.messageBody:
>For me it's not the place so much as the people.

I agree and with me it's not just my family but our homeschool support
group. We have great laws here in MO but if they changed we would move
to KS and still be able to stay with our homeschooling community. We
hope to never move but that's the plan if we ever have to. :-) Jane

-----Original Message-----
From: mc1mommy@... [mailto:mc1mommy@...]
Sent: Saturday, August 24, 2002 10:11 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] move or stay?

Mary wrote:


> Well I just don't understand holding onto a place so tightly

Good Morning,
For me it's not the place so much as the people. Once you plant us,
we
take root. My mother, two sisters, two brothers, son, daughter,
grandson.
If we packed up our youngest and moved, I'd wither away without my
family.
So we stay here in PA, crappy laws and all. Of course my son is only
six,
and we don't have to report him until he's eight. I REALLY hope we have
a
new, less restrictive law in place by then.
Mary J


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

Mary wrote:


> Well I just don't understand holding onto a place so tightly

Good Morning,
For me it's not the place so much as the people. Once you plant us, we
take root. My mother, two sisters, two brothers, son, daughter, grandson.
If we packed up our youngest and moved, I'd wither away without my family.
So we stay here in PA, crappy laws and all. Of course my son is only six,
and we don't have to report him until he's eight. I REALLY hope we have a
new, less restrictive law in place by then.
Mary J
